items.item_details: The Special Meeting of the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System will begin at 5:55 p.m. in the Mt. Pleasant High School Multi-Purpose Room.
Information explaining meeting procedures and how citizens can address the Retirement Board will be read. Written information is located near the entrance to the Multi-Purpose Room.
items.item_text: Information explaining meeting procedures and how citizens can address the Retirement Board will be read. Written information is located near the entrance to the Multi-Purpose Room.
items.item_text_raw: 2.01 Information explaining meeting procedures and how citizens can address the Retirement Board will be read. Written information is located near the entrance to the Multi-Purpose Room.

items.item_details: For consideration by the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System.
items.item_text: For consideration by the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System
items.item_text_raw: 3.01 For consideration by the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System

items.item_details:
Members of the public may address the Retirement Board on any subject not on tonight’s agenda; however, provisions of the Brown Act (Government Code Section 54954.2(a) and 54954.3) preclude any action.  As an unagendized item, no response is required from the Retirement Board or District staff and no action can be taken; however, the Retirement Board may instruct the Superintendent to agendize the item for a future meeting.  When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes.
	 
Persons wishing to address the Retirement Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Multi-Purpose Room.

When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes. Persons wishing to address the Retirement Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Multi-Purpose Room.

meeting_sections.section_name: PUBLIC MEMBERS WHO WISH TO ADDRESS THE RETIREMENT BOARD

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
			 
Item:  5.01
			 
			 
			 
TO:
Retirement Board of ESUHSD Public Retirement System
						 
						 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Member
						 
						 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action to Amend the ByLaws of the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System
			 
			 
A draft amendment to the ByLaws of the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System will be presented to the Retirement Board for adoption.
			 
			 
			 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
			 
FUNDING SOURCE:
None
RECOMMENDATION:
			It is recommended that the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System adopt the draft amendment to the ByLaws.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Retirement Board of the East Side Union High School District Public Retirement System adopt the draft amendment to the ByLaws.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
				 
Item:  5.02
				 
				 
				 
TO:
Retirement Board of ESUHSD Public Retirement System
							 
							 
FROM: 
Chris D. Funk, Member
							 
							 
SUBJECT:
Discussion/Action to Approve the Minutes of June 11, 2013, Meeting
				 
				 
				 
Attached are the meeting minutes of the June 11, 2013, Retirement Board of the ESUHSD Public Retirement Systems submitted for review and approval by the Retirement Board.
				 
				 
FISCAL IMPACT:
None
				 
FUNDING SOURCE:
None
RECOMMENDATION:
				It is recommended that the Retirement Board approve the minutes of the June 11, 2013, Retirement Board of ESUSHD Public Retirement System meeting as presented.

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
Item:  5.03
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, Cindy Mattern, Chief Financial Officer, Self-Insured Schools of California (SISC), and Fredric S. Bayles, III, CIMA, Managing Director-Investment Officer, Senior Institutional Consultant, Wells Fargo Advisors
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Presentation, Discussion and/or Action regarding Self-Insured Schools of California (SISC) GASB 45 Other Post Employment Benefits (OPEB) Irrevocable Trust Fund
		 
		 
The attached presentation from Self-Insured Schools of California (SISC) is regarding an overview and update on the performance of the Other Post Employment Benefits (OPEB) Irrevocable Trust fund.   
		 
		 
Fiscal Impact:
Not Applicable  
		 
Funding Source:
Not Applicable
		 
Recommendation:
Not Applicable

EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
Item:  5.04
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Nick Franceschine, F.S.A. Consulting Actuary, North Bay Pensions
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Presentation, Discussion and/or Action regarding GASB 45 Actuarial Report as of July 1, 2012
		 
		 
The presentation/report represents the determination of benefit obligations under Statement No. 45 of the Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB 45) as of July 1, 2012.     
		 
		 
Fiscal Impact:
Not Applicable  
		 
Funding Source:
Not Applicable
		 
Recommendation:
Not Applicable
